verses.kjv: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
verses.web: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.
verses.ct: Tax collectors and sinners of all kinds were crowding around Jesus to listen to him.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
verses.web: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”
verses.ct: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law complained, "This man welcomes sinners and even eats with them."

verses.kjv: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,
verses.web: He told them this parable.
verses.ct: So Jesus told them this parable:

verses.kjv: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
verses.web: “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep, and lost one of them, wouldn’t leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?
verses.ct: "Suppose one of you has 100 sheep and loses one of them. Wouldn't you leave the 99 out in the open and go searching for the lost one until you find it?

verses.kjv: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.web: When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.ct: When you find it, you'd lift it onto your shoulders, overjoyed.

verses.kjv: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
verses.web: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
verses.ct: Then you'd go home and call your friends and neighbors together and say, 'Celebrate with me! I found my lost sheep!'

verses.kjv: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
verses.web: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, there is more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over 99 righteous people who don't need repentance.

verses.kjv: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?
verses.web: Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn’t light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?
verses.ct: Or imagine a woman who has 10 silver coins and loses one. Wouldn't she light a lamp, sweep the entire house, and search carefully until she finds it?

verses.kjv: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.
verses.web: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.’
verses.ct: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, 'Celebrate with me! I found the coin I lost!'

verses.kjv: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
verses.web: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.”
verses.ct: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents."

verses.kjv: And he said, A certain man had two sons:
verses.web: He said, “A certain man had two sons.
verses.ct: Then Jesus said, "A man had 2 sons.

verses.kjv: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.
verses.web: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ He divided his livelihood between them.
verses.ct: The younger one said to his father, 'Father, give me my share of the inheritance now.' So the father divided his wealth between them.

verses.kjv: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
verses.web: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.
verses.ct: A few days later, the younger son packed up everything he had and left for a distant country, where he blew through all his money on wild living.

verses.kjv: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.
verses.web: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.ct: After he had spent everything, a severe famine hit that country, and he found himself with nothing.

verses.kjv: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
verses.web: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.ct: Desperate, he talked a local citizen into giving him a job, and the man sent him out to his fields to feed pigs.

verses.kjv: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
verses.web: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.
verses.ct: He was so hungry he would have gladly eaten the pods the pigs were eating, but nobody gave him a thing.

verses.kjv: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
verses.web: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!
verses.ct: Finally he came to his senses and said, 'My father's hired workers have more food than they can eat, and here I am starving to death!

verses.kjv: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,
verses.web: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.
verses.ct: I'll get up and go back to my father and tell him, "Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

verses.kjv: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
verses.web: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.” ’
verses.ct: I don't deserve to be called your son anymore. Just treat me like one of your hired workers."'

verses.kjv: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.web: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.ct: So he got up and headed home to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father spotted him. His heart broke with compassion, and he ran to his son, embraced him, and kissed him.

verses.kjv: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.
verses.web: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.ct: The son said to him, 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I don't deserve to be called your son anymore.'

verses.kjv: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:
verses.web: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and sandals on his feet.
verses.ct: But the father turned to his servants and said, 'Quick! Bring out the finest robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

verses.kjv: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:
verses.web: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let’s eat, and celebrate;
verses.ct: Bring the fattened calf and slaughter it. Let's have a feast and celebrate!

verses.kjv: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.
verses.web: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ Then they began to celebrate.
verses.ct: Because this son of mine was dead, and now he's alive again. He was lost, and now he's found.' And the celebration began.

verses.kjv: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.
verses.web: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the older son was out working in the field. As he approached the house, he heard music and dancing.

verses.kjv: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.
verses.web: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.
verses.ct: He called over one of the servants and asked what was going on.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
verses.web: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’
verses.ct: The servant told him, 'Your brother has come home, and your father slaughtered the fattened calf because he got him back safe and sound.'

verses.kjv: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.
verses.web: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.
verses.ct: The older son was furious and refused to go inside. So his father came out and pleaded with him.

verses.kjv: And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
verses.web: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.
verses.ct: But he fired back at his father, 'Look, I've slaved for you all these years and never once disobeyed you. Yet you never even gave me a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.

verses.kjv: But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.
verses.web: But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
verses.ct: But the moment this son of yours shows up — the one who burned through your money on prostitutes — you slaughter the fattened calf for him!'

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
verses.web: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.
verses.ct: His father said to him, 'Son, you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.

verses.kjv: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
verses.web: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ ”
verses.ct: But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again. He was lost, and now he's found.'"
